bibl.title: Letter from Winfield Scott to Howard A. Kelly, April 9, 1928

div1.p: Scott supplies Mabel Lazear's address and the pensions paid her by the United States Department of the Interior.

div1.head: Letter from Winfield Scott to Howard A. Kelly, April 9, 1928
div1.opener:
3-1872
OFFICE OF
THE COMMISSIONER
R
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR
BUREAU OF PENSIONS
WASHINGTON April 9, 1928
Dr. Howard A. Kelly
1406 Eutaw Place
Baltimore, Maryland
My dear Dr. Kelly:
div1.p:
In response to your inquiry of the 29th ultimo for the ad-
dress of the wife and children of Dr. Jesse W. Lazear, Acting Con-
tract Surgeon, U. S. Army, War with Spain, I have to advise you
that the widow, Mabel H. Lazear, was at one time a pensioner of
this bureau under certificate No. 535,843, under Special Act of
Congress, at the rate of $17 per month, and she was paid pension
until July 6, 1908 when she was allowed an annuity of $125 per
month by another Special Act of Congress approved July 23, 1908.
The annuity is payable by the War Department.

The bureau is informed by that department that Mrs. Lazear's
present address is 60 Oakvale Avenue, Berkeley, California.
